Walid Abdala Rfaei Jradi

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/6868170610194494
  • Última atualização do currículo em 09/09/2019

Walid Abdala Rfaei Jradi received his bachelor degree in Data Processing from the Instituto Unificado de Ensino Superior (IUESO) in 2005, his master degree in Computer Science in 2008 and his Ph.D., also in Computer Science, from the Universidade Federal de Goiás in 2016. During his graduation, he developed a study on modeling and simulation of sewage and rainwater collector networks. He also developed studies on the traveling salesman problem to optimize a system for the distribution of goods for a transportation company. In his master degree, he proposed and developed a Web-Based traffic simulator suited to the way traffic behaves in Brazilian urban road networks. During his Ph.D., he conducted studies and proposed GPU-based parallel algorithms and implementations for the problem of macroscopic assignment of urban traffic on large-scale networks. He also worked on some genetic algorithms aimed to the problem of to two-dimensional guillotine cutting. Among the areas of interest are Parallel Computing, Graph Theory, Combinatorial Optimization, Formal Languages and Automata, DataBases, Artificial Intelligence, Discrete Mathematics and Operational Research. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2018 - 2018
New Methods of Seismic Exploration using Full Waveform Inversion
Descrição: The main goal of the initiative is to research and develop new techniques to improve the efficiency of a set of seismic exploration methods, known as the ?Full Waveform Inversion? (FWI), aiming to obtain more realistic and detailed information about the subsurface geological structures, that can be used as a basis to support the location of deposits and the characterization of oil reservoirs..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Walid Abdala Rfaei Jradi - Coordenador / Hugo Alexandre Dantas do Nascimento - Integrante / João Medeiros de Araújo - Integrante / Calebe de Paula Bianchini - Integrante.
2006 - Atual
Traffic Research Group
Descrição: Encouraged by the growing interest in minimizing traffic noise, travel time, financial losses, pollution and health problems caused by poorly dimensioned road networks, since 2006 the Federal University of Goiás (UFG) through its Institutes of Informatics and Mathematics/Statistics has developed a decision support system for urban traffic planning called PetGyn. It uses a macroscopic mathematical approach for estimating vehicle flows in a modeled traffic network in a way that is most suitable to the Brazilian reality. Such a system was evaluated by experts who praised the initiative to develop technologies for this area. They also acclaimed the importance of releasing the tool as a free and web-based system, allowing collaborative modeling, simulation and analysis of networks by traffic planners. In subsequent years, PetGyn was used as a framework for supporting new research projects, focused on aspects not covered by its initial requirements and based on the positive results achieved when applied to real scenarios. This encouraged the continuation of its development, now under a broader perspective of multimodality, possible in face of the mobility and the data awareness trends of the XXI century..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Walid Abdala Rfaei Jradi - Integrante / Hugo Alexandre Dantas do Nascimento - Coordenador / Humberto José Longo - Integrante / Bryon Richard Hall - Integrante / Wanderley de Souza Alencar - Integrante / Halley Wesley Gondim - Integrante.
